intro: Deinbollia insignis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of foliage near the ground. Its flowers, which come in a variety of colors, are pollinated primarily by insects such as bees and butterflies. Deinbollia insignis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
